title: Internationalising a typeface, looking for a foundry that could help.
content:
Dear Typophile forum,

Does anyone know of a foundry that could help with internationalising a typeface (5 fonts)?  
To start with, I would need all Latin based characters:  
Latin Extended Additional  
Latin Extended-A  
Latin Extended-B  
Latin Extended-C  
Latin Extended-D  
(= 500 new glyphs).

Perhaps also Russin, Ukranian, Kazhak, Bulgarian, Macedonian, Mongolian, Uzbek, Greek, Hebrew, Kurdish, Arabic, Farsi, Korean, Chinese, Thai, Japanese, Hindi.

Thanks!
author: mårten

comments.content: [Rosetta Type Foundry](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416095910/http:/www.rosettatype.com/) would be especially capable of handling this. Email David Brezina at [info@rosettatype.com](mailto:info@rosettatype.com).

Feel free to [contact me](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416095910/http:/www.tiro.com/contact.html), and I'll be happy to discuss the project with you and provide a detailed quote.

[David B. at Rosetta is a good friend and sometime subcontractor for Tiro, and Rosetta are the distributors for some of our fonts, so collaboration is also a possibility.]
